sections.content: Incorporating  all  amendments  up  to  1  January  2006

sections.heading:
PUBLISHED BY
THE COMMISSIONER OF LAW REVISION, MALAYSIA
UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THE REVISION OF LAWS ACT 1968
IN COLLABORATION WITH
PERCETAKAN NASIONAL MALAYSIA BHD
2006
sections.content:
PUBLISHED BY
THE COMMISSIONER OF LAW REVISION, MALAYSIA
UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THE REVISION OF LAWS ACT 1968
IN COLLABORATION WITH
PERCETAKAN NASIONAL MALAYSIA BHD
2006
Incorporation of the Roman Catholic Bishop of Kuala Lumpur
3A. Change  of  name  in  respect  of  the  Titular  Roman  Catholic  Bishop  of
Incorporation of the Roman Catholic Bishop of Penang
4A. Incorporation of the Titular Roman Catholic Bishop of Malacca Johore
Saving of Crown and other rights

An  Act  to  incorporate  in  Malaysia  the  Titular  Roman  Catholic
Bishop of Malacca Johore, the Titular Roman Catholic Bishop of
Kuala Lumpur and the Titular Roman Catholic Bishop of Penang
and to provide for matters connected therewith.

sections.heading:
1. This  Act  may  be  cited  as  the  Roman  Catholic  Bishops
(Incorporation) Act 1957.
sections.content:
1. This  Act  may  be  cited  as  the  Roman  Catholic  Bishops
(Incorporation) Act 1957.
Incorporation of the Roman Catholic Bishop of Kuala Lumpur

3. (1) The  Right  Reverend  Monseigneur  Dominic  Aloysius
Vendargon  the  Titular  Roman  Catholic  Bishop  of  Kuala  Lumpur
and his successors in office shall be a body corporate (hereinafter
called “the Kuala Lumpur Corporation”) and shall for the purpose of
this Act have the name of “The Titular Roman Catholic Bishop of
Kuala  Lumpur”  and  by  that  name  have  perpetual  succession  and
shall have and may use a corporate seal which may from time to time
be broken, changed, altered and made anew as to the Kuala Lumpur
Corporation deems fit.

(2) The Kuala Lumpur Corporation may acquire, purchase, take,
hold and enjoy movable and immovable property of every description
and  may  sell,  convey,  assign,  surrender  and  yield  up,  mortgage,
demise, re-assign, transfer or otherwise dispose of any movable or
immovable property vested in it upon such terms as to such Corporation
deems fit and may sue and be sued in respect of such property in any
Court.

Change of name in respect of the Titular Roman Catholic Bishop
of Kuala Lumpur

3A. (1) The Titular Roman Catholic Bishop of Kuala Lumpur, as
incorporated under section 3 otherwise called “the Kuala Lumpur
Corporation” for the purpose of the Act shall after 15 March 1974
be  known  as  the  Titular  Roman  Catholic  Archbishop  of  Kuala
Lumpur and shall continue to be called for the purpose of the Act
“the Kuala Lumpur Corporation”.

(2) All immovable property that immediately before 15 March
1974 were vested in the Titular Roman Catholic Bishop of Kuala
Lumpur  shall  on  that  day  vest  in  the  Titular  Roman  Catholic
Archbishop of Kuala Lumpur.

(3) The change of name provided by this section shall not affect
any rights or obligations of the Titular Roman Catholic Bishop of
Kuala  Lumpur  or  render  defective  any  legal  proceedings  by  or
against it; and any legal proceedings that could have been continued
or commenced by or against it prior to that day may be continued or
commenced under its new name.
Incorporation of the Roman Catholic Bishop of Penang

4. (1) The Right Reverend Monseigneur Francis Chan the Titular
Roman Catholic Bishop of Penang and his successors in office shall
be a body corporate (hereinafter called “the Penang Corporation”)
and shall for the purpose of this Act have the name of “The Titular
Roman Catholic Bishop of Penang” and by that name have perpetual
succession and shall have and may use a corporate seal which may
from time to time be broken, changed, altered and made anew as to
the Penang Corporation deems fit.

(2) The Penang Corporation may acquire, purchase, take, hold
and enjoy movable and immovable property of every description
and  may  sell,  convey,  assign,  surrender  and  yield  up,  mortgage,
demise, re-assign, transfer or otherwise dispose of any movable or
immovable property vested in it upon such terms as to such Corporation
deems fit and may sue and be sued in respect of such property in any
Court.

Incorporation of the Titular Roman Catholic Bishop of Malacca
Johore

4A. (1) The Right Reverend Monseigneur James Chan the Titular
Roman Catholic Bishop of Malacca Johore and his successors in
office shall be a body corporate (hereinafter called “the Malacca
Johore Corporation”) and shall for the purpose of this Act have the
name of “The Titular Roman Catholic Bishop of Malacca Johore”
and by that name have perpetual succession and shall have and may
use  a  corporate  seal  which  may  from  time  to  time  be  broken,
changed, altered and made anew as to the Malacca Johore Corporation
deems fit.

(2) The  Malacca  Johore  Corporation  may  acquire,  purchase,
take, hold and enjoy all movable and immovable property of every
description and may sell, convey, assign, surrender and yield up,
mortgage, demise, re-assign, transfer or otherwise dispose of any
movable or immovable property vested in it upon such terms as to
such Corporation deems fit and may sue and be sued in respect of
such property in any Court.

4B. (1) The Titular Roman Catholic Archbishop of Singapore Malacca
as  previously  incorporated  under  section  2  of  the  Act  otherwise
called the Singapore Malacca Corporation for the purpose of the Act
in whom is vested all movable and immovable property situated in
Johore and Malacca belonging to the Singapore Malacca Corporation
immediately before 15 March1974 is hereby divested of all such
movable and immovable property and all estates rights and interests
therein.

(2) All movable and immovable property referred to in subsection
(1) and all estates rights and interests therein are hereby vested in the
Malacca  Johore  Corporation  for  the  respective  estates  rights  and
interests  for  which  the  same  are  held  and  the  Malacca  Johore
Corporation shall have full power to deal with the said property.

5. (1) The  expression  “successors  in  office”  shall  be  deemed  to
include either an Administrator Apostolic or a Vicar Capitular of the
Dioceses of Kuala Lumpur, Penang and Malacca Johore from the
time when the office of the Titular Roman Catholic Archbishop of
Kuala Lumpur, the office of the Titular Roman Catholic Bishop of
Penang  or  the  office  of  the  Titular  Roman  Catholic  Bishop  of
Malacca Johore becomes vacant by the resignation, absence or death
of  the  holder  of  such  office  for  the  time  being  until  the  formal
assumption of office by his successor.

(2) There shall not be in any one Diocese concurrent holders of
any two of the offices of Archbishop or Bishop, as the case may be,
and Administrator Apostolic or Vicar Capitular; and any power of
attorney given by any one of them shall cease to be valid when the
donor of the power of attorney ceases to administer the affairs of the
Diocese concerned.

7. (1) All  deeds,  documents  and  other  instruments  requiring  the
seal of the Kuala Lumpur Corporation shall be sealed with the seal
of  the  Kuala  Lumpur  Corporation  in  the  presence  of  the  Titular
Roman Catholic Archbishop of Kuala Lumpur for the time being or
when the Archbishopric is vacant in the presence of the Administrator
Apostolic or of the Vicar Capitular of the Diocese of Kuala Lumpur,
as  the  case  may  be,  or  by  the  attorney  of  any  one  of  them  duly
authorized by a power of attorney a true copy or an office copy of
which has been deposited pursuant to section 4 of the Powers of
Attorney Act 1949 [Act 424], and shall also be signed by the said
Archbishop for the time being or by the said Administrator Apostolic
or Vicar Capitular, as the case may be, or the attorney of any one of
them so authorized as aforesaid.

(2) All  deeds,  documents  and  other  instruments  requiring  the
seal of the Penang Corporation shall be sealed with the seal of the
Penang Corporation in the presence of the Titular Roman Catholic
Bishop of Penang for the time being or when the Bishopric is vacant
in the presence of the Administrator Apostolic or Vicar Capitular of
the Diocese of Penang, as the case may be, or the attorney of any one

of them duly authorized by a power of attorney a true copy or an
office copy of which has been deposited pursuant to section 4 of the
Powers of Attorney Act 1949, and shall be signed by the said Bishop
or by the Administrator Apostolic or Vicar Capitular, as the case
may be, or the attorney of any one of them as aforesaid.

(3) All  deeds,  documents  and  other  instruments  requiring  the
seal of the Malacca Johore Corporation shall be sealed with the seal
of the Malacca Johore Corporation in the presence of the Titular
Roman  Catholic  Bishop  of  Malacca  Johore  for  the  time  being  or
when the Bishopric is vacant in the presence of the Administrator
Apostolic or Vicar Capitular of the Diocese of Malacca Johore, as
the case may be, or the attorney of any one of them duly authorized
by a power of attorney a true copy or an office copy of which has
been deposited pursuant to section 4 of the Powers of Attorney Act
1949, and shall also be signed by the said Bishop or by the Administrator
Apostolic or Vicar Capitular, as the case may be, or the attorney or
any one of them as aforesaid.

(4) Such signing shall be and be taken as sufficient evidence that
the said seal was duly and properly affixed and that the same is the
lawful seal of the Kuala Lumpur Corporation, the Penang Corporation
or the Malacca Johore Corporation, as the case may be.

8. A notification in the Gazette of the appointment of any person
to exercise the office of the Roman Catholic Archbishop of Kuala
Lumpur,  the  Roman  Catholic  Bishop  of  Penang  or  the  Roman
Catholic Bishop of Malacca Johore or of the Administrator Apostolic
or Vicar Capitular of the Diocese of Kuala Lumpur, the Diocese of
Penang or the Diocese of Malacca Johore, as the case may be, shall
be  conclusive  evidence  that  such  person  was  duly  authorized  to
exercise the said office.

sections.heading:
9. (1) The  Kuala  Lumpur  Corporation  shall  have  an  office  in
Malaysia the address of which shall be the Saint John’s Cathedral,
Kuala Lumpur.
sections.content:
9. (1) The  Kuala  Lumpur  Corporation  shall  have  an  office  in
Malaysia the address of which shall be the Saint John’s Cathedral,
Kuala Lumpur.

(2) The Penang Corporation shall have an office in Malaysia the
address of which shall be the Cathedral of the Assumption, Penang.

(3) The  Malacca  Johore  Corporation  shall  have  an  office  in
Malaysia the address of which shall be the Cathedral of the Immaculate
Conception, Johore Bahru.

sections.heading:
10. The  Ordinance  and  Enactments  specified  in  the  Schedule
hereto insofar as the same affect Malaysia are hereby repealed.
sections.content:
10. The  Ordinance  and  Enactments  specified  in  the  Schedule
hereto insofar as the same affect Malaysia are hereby repealed.
Saving of Crown and other rights

11. Nothing  in  this  Act  contained  shall  affect  the  rights  of  Her
Majesty or of Their Highnesses the Rulers of the States or of any
body politic or corporate or of any other person except such as are
mentioned in this Act and those claiming by, through or under them.
